title: Hugo Lloris tells Tottenham he wants to stay at the club – so long as Mauricio Pochettino remains as manager
text:
Comments HUGO LLORIS is happy to remain at Tottenham — if manager Mauricio Pochettino stays. 
The French No 1 is being eyed by Europe’s top clubs — including Paris Saint-Germain and Real Madrid. PA:Press Association Hugo Lloris says he wants to stay at Tottenham despite interest from Europe 
But Lloris said: “My destiny is linked to Mauricio, that’s a certainty. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Tottenham news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
“Our relationship matters a lot to me, it goes beyond football. Reuters 3 Hugo Lloris has been targeted by Paris Saint Germain and Real Madrid 
“It’s a partnership and one day everyone will see   he is the best coach in the world. For me, he is already at that level. 
“His presence and our relationship are the two most important things to me.” 
Lloris’ comments in the French press will please Tottenham fans but pundits and fans in France want him to move to a bigger club. The 30-year-old only signed a new long-term contract with Spurs last December, which keeps him at the club until 2022. 
And he insists staying in north London does not represent a lack of ambition on his part – because he wants to start delivering trophies with the club in the next few years. Getty Images Lloris only signed a new deal with Tottenham last December 
Lloris added: “I will not say I lack ambition.
